intro: Tricuspis nealleyi, commonly known as the New Zealand tricuspis, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tricuspis nealleyi is considered a vulnerable species.
